channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023060519
item.description:
Report E-2023060519

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 05, 2023, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3288 were torn in transit and released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the site. VER personnel placed the damaged bags in one (1) lined cubic yard box. The crew then wiped down the impacted freight and rewrapped the pallet for further shipping. One (1) 55-gallon drum containing miscellaneous debris from the cleanup was left onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060438
item.description:
Report E-2023060438

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 01, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN1263 primer was punctured and released approximately 31-gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew then collected and containerized all UN1263 impacted materials in five (5) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 50 pound bag of nitrates (un1477) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 0.5 pounds of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023060118
item.description:
Report E-2023060118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: KENOSHA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 released approximately one-half (0.5) cup of product due to not being properly secured for transport. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enviroserve (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed neutralizing agent to the release, then deployed absorbents. The crew utilized hand tools to collect all UN1791 impacted material into one (1) drum liner for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060311
item.description:
Report X-2023060311

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The steel drum looks as if has been dropped multiple times, dents on the top and bottom and in the middle. It is leaking some through the seams on the bottom of the drum. DescribePack: the drum is leaking through the seam where the sides and the bottom meet. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: the drum was put into a plastic spill bag and then into the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023060273
item.description:
Report X-2023060273

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the package torn and open, and also wet from the 2 plastic bottles that are leaking out of their caps. this package is 1 of a multiple. it leaked on the other one in the shipment. DescribePack: The caps of two of the bottles are lose and the inner seals are torn, and they are leaking out. the box is damaged beyond use. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: The boxes where both put into a plastic spill prof bag, and then into a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060061
item.description:
Report X-2023060061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: West Allis
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While on the dock a pallet of UN1727 was hit near the bottom of the pallet by a piece of freight being moved with a forklift. Two bags of the UN1727 had a small hole torn in the bag. The torn bags leaked 2 ounces of the UN1727 onto the dock floor. The spill was cleaned with cement powder. The s mall hole in the two bags was taped and shrink wrapped. The recouped spill and cement powder was placed into a salvage pail and is being held for disposition
